The 'CritÃ©rium International' is a twoâday bicycle stage race held in France
every spring. It was formerly known as the 'CritÃ©rium National de la Route',
first run in 1932.

For many years it was considered a sort of French national championship and was
finally opened to nonâFrench cyclists in 1979. Bernard Hinault is the only
cyclist to win the race in both its forms. The race has been won by some of the
most famous names in cycling, including Jacques Anquetil, Sean Kelly, Bernard
Hinault, Miguel Indurain, Stephen Roche, Joop Zoetemelk, Laurent Fignon, Cadel
Evans and Chris Froome.
